subject: Politics
title: South Africa's Transition
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: South Africa's Transition.

hook.text: South Africa ended apartheid without a civil war. That makes it one of history's most remarkable political transitions.

buildup.text: Apartheid segregated South Africa by race for decades. The white minority ruled while the Black majority suffered.

discovery.text: Nelson Mandela spent 27 years in prison. His release in 1990 signaled the beginning of negotiations.

twist.text: Mandela chose reconciliation over revenge. The Truth and Reconciliation Commission traded justice for peace.

climax.text: Democracy came in 1994. But economic inequality persists. Political freedom didn't deliver economic equality.

punchline.text: South Africa proves peaceful change is possible. It also shows its limits.

quiz.question: What was the purpose of South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission?
options: To trade full justice for national peace and reconciliation
